    • Uses of Player in it.polimi.group03.engine

      Methods in it.polimi.group03.engine that return Player 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Player GameEngine.getNextPlayer(Player player)
      This method retrieves the next player in the game.
      Player GameEngine.getWinner()
      This method checks whether there is a winner or not, there is a winner only when the game has finished, in this case the method retrieves the winning player.
      Methods in it.polimi.group03.engine with parameters of type Player 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      StatusMessage GameEngine.addBeadToBoard(Player player, Bead bead)
      This method adds a new bead for the selected player if and only if it complies with the rules established by the Game.
      StatusMessage GameEngine.addPlayer(Player player)
      This method adds a new player to the game if and only if it complies with the rules established by the Game.
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> GameBrain.getBestBarToMove(GameEngine engine, Player me, Player theOtherGuy, int level)
      For both orientations (horizontal or vertical), the algorithm will search for the bar and the position in which most of the opponent's beads will fall, by counting the defeats and validating according to the game rules if the movement is valid, if no, will retrieve the next best bar/position.
      private Bar GameBrain.getBestDefensiveBar(GameEngine engine, Player me)
      If the algorithm wasn't able to find a proper bar to move and defeats the opponents' beads, nor place at least one of his/her beads on a cover slot, the next move will be a defensive one, which means that will retrieve a new position that will cover most of are own beads with both bars without committing suicide.
      Player GameEngine.getNextPlayer(Player player)
      This method retrieves the next player in the game.
      private Bar GameBrain.getRandomBar(GameEngine engine, Player me, java.util.List<Bar> bars)
      Murphy Law, if it isn't possible to find a proper bar to move, will return the first bar allowed.
      private boolean GameBrain.isConsecutiveBarMoveValid(GameEngine engine, Player player, Bar selectedBar)
      This method checks the movement that a player tries to do when there are only two players left in the game, in order to do it validates the selected bar against the the list of moved bars, and checks if this particular player has two consecutive moves, if so compares the bar with those two moves, if it is the same bar that the one that was moved before returns a negative response, if not returns a positive response.
      private boolean GameEngine.isRoundFinished(Player player)
      This method checks whether the current round has finished or not.
      private boolean GameBrain.isSelectedBarMoveValid(GameEngine engine, Player player, Bar selectedBar)
      This method checks that the bar selected by the player has not been slid by any of his/her opponents in the previous turn.
      StatusMessage GameEngine.makeMove(int id, BarOrientation orientation, BarPosition targetPosition, Player currentPlayer)
      This method should be called when a player tries to make a move, before refreshing the state of the game, it will perform a validation according to the rules established for the game.
      private void GameEngine.refreshMovedBarsInRound(Player player, Bar bar)
      This method adds the bar moved by the player to the list of bars that have been moved in the round Game.movedBarsByOpponents It also deletes the second previous move of the user in order to store just what it requires to fulfill the game rules.
      private StatusMessage GameValidator.validateConsecutiveBarMove(Player player, Bar selectedBar)
      This method checks the movement that a player tries to do when there are only two players left in the game, in order to do it validates the selected bar against the the list of moved bars, and checks if this particular player has two consecutive moves, if so compares the bar with those two moves, if it is the same bar that the one that was moved before returns a negative response, if not returns a positive response.
      StatusMessage GameValidator.validateCurrentPlayerDifferentFromPreviousPlayer(Player currentPlayer)
      This method checks that a player does not play two times in a row.
      StatusMessage GameValidator.validateMove(Bar selectedBar, BarPosition targetPosition, Player currentPlayer)
      This method checks whether the movement a player is trying to do complies with the rules established for the game.
      StatusMessage GameValidator.validatePlacedBead(Player currentPlayer, Bead newBead)
      This method checks that a player places a bead in an allowable position; in order to do so first checks the number of beads the player has already placed, then checks if the position of the new bead is valid i.e if the new bead is been placed in a holed slot or if there is already a bead in the selected slot.
      private StatusMessage GameValidator.validateSelectedBarMove(Player player, Bar selectedBar)
      This method checks that the bar selected by the player has not been slid by any of his/her opponents in the previous turn.
